title: Installing League Crashes My Computer
body:
So for 2 months now I've been trying to install league of legends in my laptop (Alienware 14) and for some reason after the client is installed and and patch is downloading, all the processes in my computer will start crashing untill I finally have to shut it down by holding the power button. This all started after I upgraded my Hard Drive from a 500 GB one to a 1 T because I was having some issues with the old one. ( Disk usage was always 100%) and I couldn't fix it in any way, and basically couldn't use my computer because of it. After I changed it and isntalled a clean version of Windows 10 it looked like the problem was solved, but the thing is that even after changing my hard drive I still get the disk usage up to 100%. I can install any other program, but when it comes to league it will always crash my computer. I've tried everything, and even the repair tool crashes. I would really need some help {{item:3070}}  {{item:3070}} 

Pd: English is not my first lenguage so sorry for that :p

replies.body: It's strange to hear that it's taking so much processing power to install or update, and is pretty unusual.  When you get a chance, download our [hextech repair tool](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/224826367) to grab some logs and attach them to a [support ticket](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new).  This will help our tech team find out if there's a hiccup somewhere and help directly with a solution.  We'll see you there!
I've tried using the repair tool, but after I hit "Start" after around 15 - 20 secs I get an error saying_ "Chromium Embedded Framework (CEF) Client Application  Stoped Working"_ :/
No worries, still make a ticket so we can work with you directly and find some options for you.
Ok, I will do that. Thanks for the help!
